Job Description

The opportunity

The Senior ServiceNow ITSM Engineer (SACM/ITAM/ITOM) will be responsible for managing, servicing, supporting, monitoring, and maintaining Configuration Management System (CMS/CMDB) governance. In addition, the Senior ServiceNow ITSM Engineer will build the framework to manage integrations required for identification and reconciliation processes (IRE) across different data sources within the CMS/CMDB. This technical role will involve IT Operations Management (ITOM) and IT Asset Management (ITAM) management capabilities and proven experience to plan, build, and support digital services, infrastructure technology, components, applications, common services data model (CSDM), hardware, and software assets in ServiceNow CMDB and IT Asset Management Modules (HAM/SAM Pro). Additional responsibilities include data analysis, auditing, quality reviews and data entry into the Configuration Management Database (CMDB), electronic discovery, enhancements, and reporting.

Responsibilities

Maintain governance and operations of the CMS/CMDB and Asset Management repositories on the ServiceNow platform.
Lead operations and support SACM, ITAM, and ITOM processes.
Own requirements, stories, enhancements, and strategic development
Lead all aspects of ITSM processes and integrations, third party tools, Now platform certified marketplace tools, systems, and workflows
Responsible for governance, policies, procedures, workflows, and documenting and communicating SACM and ITAM processes globally.
Lead, maintain, support, and configure CMS/CMDB Health related system properties, health metric rules, and aggregating data for health calculations and other CMDB Health behavior.
Run CMDB discovery scans, schedules, error correction, missing data, and support CMDB service and intake tickets.
Represent the Service Aware Mapping team as an SME and lead contact for Configuration Management (CMS/CMDB), Infrastructure (Hardware) and Business Applications (Software) governance.
Collaborate with global colleagues across segments to support the global directive and roadmap
Lead joint initiatives and integrations with ITIL disciplines including Change, Incident and Problem Management and Application portfolio Management (APM).

What motivates you?

You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit.
You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile approach and enable business outcomes.
You thrive in teams and enjoy getting things done together.
You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters.
You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up.
You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone.

What We Are Looking For

Relevant IT Based post-secondary degree or higher
5+ years ServiceNow Technical Configuration Management experience
4 years configuring, testing, and maintaining a CMDB, ITAM, or IT Service Management system (Preferably ServiceNow)
Minimum 3 years of leading moderate-scale project implementation and discovery tool installations
Configuration Management Certification (ServiceNow Configuration Management Database (CMDB) Fundamentals or other industry recognized certification
IAITAM or industry certification
ITIL certification (minimum ITIL v4 Foundation)
Broad cross-discipline knowledge in networks, infrastructure, and IT security
Experienced in creating and maintaining process documentation and architectural diagrams for SACM/ITAM/ITOM
Expert level experience in managing and configuring the ServiceNow CMDB health dashboard.
Expert level experience in the design, development, and implementation of automated processes to gather, populate, validate, audit, attest, and maintain CI and Asset data.
Expert level experience with web and cloud technologies including JavaScript, HTML, XML, Web Services, and API’s

What can we offer you?

A competitive salary and benefits packages.
A growth trajectory that extends upward and outward, encouraging you to follow your passions and learn new skills.
A focus on growing your career path with us.
Flexible work policies and strong work-life balance.
Professional development and leadership opportunities.

About Manulife And John Hancock

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Asia, Canada, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2022, we had more than 40,000 employees, over 116,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 34 million customers. At the end of 2022, we had $1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, including total invested assets of $0.4 trillion (US $0.3 trillion), and segregated funds net assets of $0.3 trillion (US$0.3 trillion). We trade as ‘MFC’ on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges, and under ‘945’ in Hong Kong.
